Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds

answers.answer: web3.py is the standard for interacting with the Ethereum blockchain for Python developers.
answers.question: Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?

answers.answer: web3.py is designed and documented with newcomers in mind. [Documentation](https://web3py.readthedocs.io/en/stable/), the [blog](https://snakecharmers.ethereum.org/), and [events](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tetTX0ozcCg) are a priority and offer different entry points for understanding how to use the tools. In more professional environments, power users can reach for asynchronous patterns and advanced features and configurations. web3.py and its underlying libraries power a wide range of apps, development frameworks, protocols, and data pipelines.
answers.question: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.

answers.answer: web3.py has +3 million downloads per month: https://pypistats.org/packages/web3
answers.question: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.

answers.answer: Unordered, our team's current north stars are to 1) reduce UX friction for app developers, 2) educate and inspire builders, and 3) aid in the implementation and testing of EIPs. Secure funding allows us to do what we think best moves the needle for the Ethereum community.
answers.question: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]â€”for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: web3.py
project.description:
[web3.py](https://github.com/ethereum/web3.py/) is the standard for interacting with the Ethereum blockchain for Python developers. The open source library garners well over one million downloads per month and underpins many Python developer tools, including the Ape and Brownie development frameworks. web3.py-adjacent libraries, including [py-evm](https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/), are dependencies in the Vyper/Titanoboa development stack.

More broadly, we value language diversity within Ethereum tooling, and believe the path to mass adoption requires meeting developers where they are. The [web3.py](https://github.com/ethereum/web3.py/) API, documentation, blog, and reference repos place high priority on approachability for anyone comfortable with Python.
